comment: I would not take Bell if you have the chance not to. Very monotone, does not give examples, all he does is write lines about the material. No hands on problems. If you want practice problems use the book (which is hardly ever used) or connect math. Wouldnt suggest him as a professor.

The lectures are long, class is not mandatory, so you do not have to go. The information he presents is from the book, so you can just study the book, and go in to take the tests. Do all of the ConnectMath! It is 20% of your grade, and really helps come test time! I even went back and did practice problems! Bell is willing to help! Grateful to him!

There's only 3 multiple choice tests and a final that can replace your lowest test grade. Although lectures are very boring, they can be somewhat helpful but if you can teach yourself the material just don't go to class because he can be confusing at times. Overall not a bad teacher, just a slow talker, and an easy A if you put some effort in.

A lot of people on here gave him a good grade cause he is an easy A, the problem with that is you don't learn anything from professors who dont challenge you at all.  The lecture was extremely basic, to the point that a middle school student would get an A here.  I think statistics could be cool, but not the way its taught by him.

You really have to work outside of class to understand the material. He is very strict on anything he grades. this would have been an easy A class except his Final was cumulative and even though I made all no lower than a B and mostly As for the entire class, I still ended up with a B because I failed the final . I studied for the final for 4 days.

Had him for 8am, extremely boring. He is monotone but its an overall easy class. Just know the formulas and do the homework which is only like 10 or less questions per section and you have an unlimited amount of tries. All tests are 20 multiple choice questions. Drops lowest grade with final.

Bell understands this is a gen-ed class. He makes the class easy to pass, the homework has unlimited tries, and the tests are all multiple choice. However, his lectures are super boring, he speaks slow and is pretty monotone.

Class is super easy! IF MATH IS EASY FOR YOU, THEN HE IS FOR YOU! Tests are 20 MC questions that are calculator based and vocab. Really easy! Attendance does not count! HW is MC on econnect and is super easy! Final is MC and is old questions on previous 3 tests + 5 questions from new unit! Final is 25 quest. 3 tests, final, and hw! each 100 points!
Very boring lectures. However, this had to be one the easiest classes I've taken in college. Almost EVERYTHING can be done with your calculator. Also, try to avoid the 8am.

Professor Bell is an awful teacher i do not recommend him if you are trying to get an A in an east course. This class is easy, but he does not show you how to solve problems. He simply just recites definitions that you find in the text book. If you are taking his class i recommend buying the text book and teaching your self.

I loved math going into his class made an A in the last 4 math classes I took, then got a C in his class. Very boring and not easy to hear. He will put notes up but they are all handwritten and somewhat hard to read. He doesn't do a very good job at teaching you how to solve problems, you're better off teacher yourself with the book.

He's different from most teachers when it comes to his personality, not a bad thing. He's very kind. Clear and concise. Easy A if you do homework online and look over/practice problems in book. Don't need to come to class. But he pre-hand writes notes on overhead that are similar to book so it's useful to get them then. Tests are like homework.

If you are already somewhat familiar with entry level statistics, or good at teaching yourself, take his class. Otherwise, go elsewhere. He absolutely cannot answer a question - gets flustered and awkward. Moves slow in the beginning, faster towards the end.

He has no inflection in his voice what so ever. I do believe he has some sort of autism, all jokes aside. He is very organized and cannot think outside his box. He will not answer questions. Your grade is whatever your tests are. He is very thorough. Boring, but math is not cartwheels and clowns.

started great but as course progressed he moved on whether or not u understood.if ur bad at math,get a tutor.wont answer ?s b4 test& when i asked 4 help he only referred me to math lab. i got a B w/ help&studying.3 tests,final replaces lowest grade.easy homework &counts as test grade. test ?s from homewrk& textbook wrk. has social problems but nice

This guy cannot teach at all. If you need clarity and a good teacher, do not take his class. He just teaches from the notes. If you take this class your going to have to either teach yourself or get a tutor

When I read the reviews on this prof, I thought that sure, he might not be all that fun and exciting, but it's math, right? Well, he is the epitome of boring. In fact, all jokes aside, I think he may have some kind of social disorder (Asperger's. Very sweet and very understanding, but at the same time it's just awkward. Good Proff just boring.

3 tests: 2 during term, cummulative final.  Final replaces lowest test grade if higher.  VERY BORING-however, notes are CRYSTAL clear. Tests are easy - just read questions THOROUGHLY so you don't make dumb mistakes. Go to class, TAKE ALL NOTES & you'll have an A. (But bring your laptop, so you have something to do while taking notes- He is boring)

When I read the reviews on here I thought he would be a little boring but helpful.  UHM NO.  He is absolutely the MOST boring teacher/person ever!  I don't fall asleep in classes, but I fell asleep every single day. His first test was easy, but the other two were hard (and I'm good at math!). Tests are only grades, 3, final replaces lowest, got a B

This is quite possibly the most boring teacher on the face of the earth. However, the tests are easy and attendance is not mandatory. The bad part is tests are 100% of your grade, so if you are a bad test taker, I would not advise. It's pretty easy though

Statistics is a very easy class if you take this guy. Attendance is not mandatory and his lectures are very boring. Homework is not graded. Sometimes he is unclear about certain things. There is probably a better teacher at this school, but if he's an option take him. Easy A or B
Monotone, but great teacher. Very consistent and repetitious. It's VERY difficult NOT to understand the material. He is VERY thorough. Not a thrill seeker, or social, but still a great professor.

He is monotone, reads out loud straight from his notes, and shows no emotion. Other than that, this class is pretty easy. Tests are 20 multiple choice questions. homework problems from book, so get it; you need to study from it! overall, easy A!

His lectures are boring and you just take notes everyday. But the tests are relatively easy if you have done the homework (20 multiple choice questions). Attendance is not mandatory and he gives the opportunity to replace the lowest test grade with the final grade. He is very knowledgable about Statistics.

He speaks in monotone and his idea of teaching is putting horribly hand written notes on a projector and reading them word for word!  AVOID if possible!  If you can learn that way great but I know a lot of people who can't and failed his class or got their lowest math grade ever!

He's a pretty meek guy, and it shows in his lectures. Honestly, these lectures are boring. Very. But as long as you keep up with the chapter assignments and check up with him if you're confused, you'll get an A. His exams are pretty straightforward, after all.

OMG BORING!!! Roughly as interesting as a glass of tepid water. If you get stuck in his class (like I did) you're better off just reading the book and showing up for the reviews before the tests, he's actually more confusing than helpful. God help you if you ask him a question, it takes him AT LEAST 15 minutes to still not answer it!

I have heard many bad reviews about him from other students because he has a hard time explaing things to the students, but he honestly tries very hard to make people understand the subject. Also if he sees that the class is failing, he will make the next test easier. He is a professor who defiitely cares about his students passing.
He teaches very slow, which is good. However it is very easy to fall asleep in his class. The book was very different from what he taught in class, so practicing problems at home was difficult.
EASY A CLASS.  Bell is monotone and moves at a very slow pace - lectures are BORING - but he makes sure everything is crystal clear. Tests are very easy. Homework and book use not required.

I am so stupid when it comes to anything to do with math I have taken Stats 3 times and on my third time w/Bell I pass. I made a D and that is all i needed for my major. i could have made a C if I wasn't doing an internship but I am done w/Stats.Bell is detailed.very monotone but he is good take it from a dummy in math. I tell anyone to take him
Boring and slow to a point that it is entertaining. Tells you what you need to know to do well. Easy.

This class was a lot different than any other math classes that I had taken. But its Statistics. GOOD CLASS. It's not the most entertaining, but he is crystal clear of everything that you should know. GO TO CLASS AND GET THE NOTES! If you don't you will not do well. Drops the lowest test grade and and a cumulative final.(not bad with notes)
I dare you to try to stay awake!!!

He has zero personality & you will write A LOT, his lectures are on overhead he doesn't interact with the class. BUT-he makes it easy to understand & he shows you how to use the calc. Final is very hard,its cumulative.I still got B overall. If you aren't good in math I would recommend him but you must to go to class. Good Professor, boring subject!
Great teacher. He goes through everything very slow and breaks it all down until you get it. That said, he is TERRIBLY boring. If you go, you should get an A. If you don't, you'll have a harder time.

If you are not confident in math or want a good grade, take Bell for Stats! His class is mostly lecture (notes on the overhead) but he is very clear what to know & goes at a slow pace. There are three 20q multiple choice tests+final (he replaces a low score with grade on final)& a lot of people made A's! Study the notes & do the HW, you'll be fine.

Dr. Bell is the best math professor/teacher I have had in my life.  The man straight up knows how to teach.  I needed a tutor to get through math modeling.  With Dr. Bell I didn't for statistics and almost scored an A.  Anyone who complains about him being slow and explaining the math needs to go back to high school and grow up.

Yes, he may seem boring but if you are scared to take stats like I was then you need to take this professor. He explains everything soooo well that you are able to understand clearly. He is awesome. He helped me to understand. He is an excellent teacher. Shows you step by step how to do everything on calculator.

VERY VERY VERY BORING... HE GOES INTO WAY MORE DETAIL THAN IS NECESSARY AND ENDS UP MAKING IT CONFUSING.  HIS TESTS ARE EASY IF YOU UNDERSTAND THE MATERIAL... ALL MULTIPLE CHOICE BUT HE DOESN'T GIVE MAKE-UP'S OR EXTRA CREDIT.  WOULD NEVER TAKE HIM AGAIN FOR ANY OTHER CLASS!!!!

A very thorough teacher. He goes in a very slow pace so the material is clearly understood. It might seem boring, but it is definately worth it. His test are multiple choie and he explain exactly what going to be on the test. His test are fairly easy if you review your notes, do homework and learn to use the calculator(which he will show you. Super
I love this man! He is such a thorough professor- he explains the material so well. He may be a little boring but it is worth it to sit through his class. Not easy but if you study you'll make an A.
this guy is one of the best teachers. though he may be a little slow and a bit boring, i made a good grade because he is very thorough
He goes very slow over the material and is very thorough in his notes!  He was a very good teacher.
A really boring class, but an easy A. He tells how to put almost everything into the calculator. The tests are mostly multiple choice.
He was a pretty easy teacher.  He explained things really well.  Tests are multiple choice.  For test review, he basically reads you the test.  Great teacher.  Take him if you can.
He is very slow on teaching the lessons. He puts great emphasis on how to type things into the TI-83 (only).  He was alright, but I don't think that I will take him again

Great notes and Exam Reviews. Very organized. His pace is slow, giving a great opportunity to all students to understand the material. Always exemplifies problems. Takes the time to write everything on the board. If you take notes and do homework you'll get A. No extra work/quiz required just exams.

Great instructor! Tests are all multiple choice all you have to do is take down his notes and you will pass. He is not very animated so class may be a little boring but then again it is math. I would definitely take another math class with him if, I had to.

Do the homework and come to class. He uses the book some, but mostly goes by his notes for exams. Exams count for all of your grade, so you must do well on them. He gives great notes and tests are multiple choice.

Dr. Bell's test seemed to be extremely hard...most students dropped his class within the first 2 weeks, but he gave curves and explained the material well.  You have to be willing to study!! This is NOT an easy class!!

I don't dislike Mr. Bell, but I'm not very good at math and I've found that he's not very helpful. He barely talks to the class and is a really dry teacher. His tests do come from the notes and homework, so make sure to show up and you MUST do the homework problems. Your grade is only from 4 tests.

Class is very easy if you study the wondeful notes he gives.  Tests are taken from notes and homework.  If you study the notes and do the homework, this class is no problem.  Thanks to Dr.Bell for making it this way!

Great teacher.  He went over all material until he was sure it was understood.  Notes and examples were excellent and helped out a lot with the HW.  The tests were easy- just questions from the HW and notes.  Study HW and notes and you'll be fine.
Seems scared of his students. Tries to help but can't communicate well. VERY difficult to pass class unless you're just good at calculus.
